column4: I accidentally removed the network manager from my top panel, how do I put it back?
try right-click on panel and "Add to panel"
I did that but then I don't know whihink it's in that listch applet to choose, I don't t
I don't think the network manager applet is in thhat list
do you have network-manager-gnome package installed?
ummm, if it's not installed by default then no
you are talking about the applet used to select wifi networks, right?
you said you "removed it from the top panel", does that mean you right-clicked and selected "remove from panel"?
ya I thought it would be really easy to add back but the " network manager"
then it should be in the "add to panel" list
there is a network manager in the list when I click add to panel but it's not the right one
it's different and doesn't function the same way
the applet that shows network activity in a nice graph is _not_ the network manager applet. you are not talking about that, right?
what did the applet you removed look like?
